sourceMeaningMnemonic: Someone <radical>thread</radical>ed a <radical>turtle</radical> into long skinny pieces, making a <kanji>rope</kanji>.
meaningInfo: A rope made of threaded turtles. Go ahead and grab onto it and see how it feels. A little rough, but strong.
readingMnemonic: The person making these threaded turtle <kanji>rope</kanji>s is the local giant farmhand <reading>Jou</reading>rm (<ja>じょう</ja>). You watch him stretch and peel pieces of turtle off of turtles, then thread them together into a rope.
readingInfo: Besides being awful, where did Jourm learn to thread turtles into ropes? Why does he have so many turtles despite living on such an inland farm? These are nice ropes that Jourm is making though, and you kind of want to buy some.
